headline: Exclusive-Bank of America eliminates some investment banking roles, sources say
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Bank of America eliminated some investment banking roles on Monday, including in New York, according to three sources familiar with the situation who declined to be identified discussing personnel matters.  The cuts affected junior bankers, including analysts and associates, the three sources said.  The small number of employees whose jobs were trimmed could be redeployed in comparable positions elsewhere in the company, one of the sources said.

headline: US bank stocks, Apple, consumer staples: Market Minute
summary: Madison Mills outlines the top stories on Wall Street as part of today's Market Minute. Major US bank stocks, including JPMorgan (JPM), Bank of America (BAC), and Citi (C), drop amid a broader market sell-off. Apple (AAPL) shares fall as the tech titan announces a delay to its Siri upgrade. Consumer staples (XLP) rise as investors turn to a defensive play amid worries of a slowdown. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) Reports US$3,535 Million Buyback as Stock Dips 10%
summary: Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) reported a price move of 9.82% during the last quarter, which coincided with several key corporate actions and broader market trends. The company announced the redemption of significant debt components and completed a substantial share repurchase program, with the recent buyback totaling $3,535 million, possibly influencing investor perception. Despite a challenging broader market environment, marked by a 3.4% weekly decline of major indexes like the S&P 500 due to...
